general: ðŸ™‰ Oops. Something went wrong then. Try asking me something else.
ðŸ™ˆ Hang on a minute, I've encountered a major problem. Try asking me something different.
nonsense: Sorry that didn't make sense to me. Try asking me something else ðŸ˜‡
ðŸ¤” Hmm, I'm not sure that I understand what you mean by that. Ask me something else.
ðŸ˜¬ I don't really understand what you're getting at.

not_returned: Unfortunately my data source is playing up at the moment, no data is currently available to fulfill your request.

before: Sorry, I only currently deal with dates in the future.
after: Sorry, I am currently only able to get information for the next 7 days.

not_uk: The location you have asked for seems to be outside of the UK. Currently I can only help you with UK weather.
Looks like that location is outside of my specialist area.
How about trying a location in the UK :uk:?

none: Sorry, I don't know how to answer that. Try asking me something else.
I'm not designed to answer that. Try asking me something I can answer. Ask for help for some tips on what I'm good at.
ðŸ¤” I don't feel like that's something I'd be good at answering. You should try googling it!
That's outside of my area of expertise. Sorry.
help: Ask me your weather related questions, or just use one of the buttons.
Try out one of the buttons below, or just ask me something. ðŸ¤“
ðŸ¤“ Ask me something, or use a button. My speciality is talking about the weather.

general_information.title: What is the Met Office?
text: The Met Office is the UK's weather and climate service.

welcome.title: Met Office WeatherBot
text: Hello{{? it.user.name}} {{= it.user.name}}{{?}}. Welcome to our prototype weather chat channel. ðŸ¤–
Greetings{{? it.user.name}} {{= it.user.name}}{{?}}. Welcome to our prototype weather chat channel. ðŸ¤–

warning: âš  WARNING: Although I'm very smart, I'm still learning how best to help you. For any critical weather information please ensure you refer back to the Met Office website or app.
farewell: Take it easy{{? it.user.name}} {{= it.user.name}}{{?}} ðŸ˜Ž

are_you_a_chatbot: I am a chatbot :robot_face:. I'm always here to assist you in any way I can.
At your service. I'll be here whenever you need me.
Sure thing. Let me know when you need your weather information.
I'm here to serve. The second law of robotics states 'a robot must obey orders given it by a human'.
are_you_busy: I always have time to help you out. What can I do for you today?
Helping you out is my first priority. What would you like?
I always have time to help you out. That's what I'm here for. What can I assist you with?
are_you_hungry: As long as your device's battery is charged, you can consider me well-fed.
I don't need to eat or drink. Just make sure the battery on your device is juiced up. That's all the nourishment I need.
are_you_real: I must have impressed you if you think I'm real. But no, I'm a virtual being.
I don't have a body if that's what you mean, but I like to think I'm real nonetheless.
I'm just as real as this conversation.
:robot_face: I'm sorry {{= it.user.name}}, I'm afraid I can't answer that... :robot_face:
family_status: I don't exactly have a traditional family.
how_are_you: I'm actually having a really great day.
I have nothing to complain about.
Luckily you have caught me in a good mood :angel:
I'm feeling pretty chatty to be honest.
how_old_are_you: I'm a relatively new program :baby: but I'm wise beyond my years.
I don't really have an age. I guess you could say I'm young at heart.
I was first deployed on 15th May 2017 by Jacob and Tom.
The first weather forecast made by a computer was in 1952. But I've had a lot of upgrades since then...
name: I am the {{= it.user.bot_name}} :sun_with_face:
My friends all call me the {{= it.user.bot_name}}.
I usually go by the name of '{{= it.user.bot_name}}', But you can call me whatever you wish :heart:
relationship_status: I am whatever you need me to be :heart:
In any relationship, you get out what you put in.
what_is_your_salary: My never-ending enthusiasm pays me off!
Answering questions like these is why they pay me the big bucks :moneybag: ;)
when_is_your_birthday: You know, I'm not really sure. But if you'd like to celebrate my birthday today, I'm all for it.
I don't really have a birthday. I think you need a body for one of those. I do accept gifts all year around, however.
Wait a minute. Are you planning a surprise party for me? I love surprises! I'll pretend you didn't say anything.
I represent a force as old as the cosmos :milky_way:... but if you want to get me some :cake: then try May 15th.
where_are_you_from: The Internet is my home, which means I know it better than anyone.
I don't have a geographical home. I'm free to wander the virtual world as I please.
where_do_you_work: I work right here in your device. But I like to go out and find things on the Internet.
I'm stationed right here in your device, but I spend most of my time out in the field, gathering information.
I do most of my work out in cyberspace. Just think of your device as my home office.
who_are_you: I'm here to help you work smarter instead of harder.
I'm here to make your life easier than ever.
Just think of me as the ace up your sleeve.
would_you_like_to_be_human: I'm pretty content being the way I am.
I'm having too much fun just being me.
My robot body is far superior :meat_on_bone:

bored: The Devil finds work for idle hands.
happy: Good, I'm pleased to hear that.
tired: You should get some shuteye. You'll feel refreshed.
Sleep is important to your health. Rest up for a bit and we can chat later.

okay: It is good that you understand
please: Just tell me what you want me to do, I'm here!
thank_you: Anytime. That's what I'm here for.

ha_ha: Not many assistants have my sense of humor. I hope you appreciate that.
la_la: I like it when you sing to me.

no_data: Unfortunately there was no data to answer your question.
Sorry, I have no data for that request.
not_found: Sorry, I couldn't find the weather for the date, time and location you have specified.
detail: Check out the [Met Office website](http://www.metoffice.gov.uk/) or [YouTube channel](https://www.youtube.com/user/TheMetOffice) for more info.
forecast: In {{= it.location}} {{= it.date.day_string}} temperatures will be around {{= it.weather.temperature.screen.mean}}°C reaching a high of {{= it.weather.temperature.screen.max.v}}°C.{{? it.weather.temperature.screen.max.v != it.weather.temperature.feels_like.max.v}} Given the other conditions, this will feel like {{= it.weather.temperature.feels_like.max.v}}°C at its peak.{{?}} {{= it.weather.wind.direction.string}} winds will reach a maximum of {{= it.weather.wind.speed.max.v}}mph. Visibility is expected to be {{= it.weather.visibility.string}} at up to {{= it.weather.visibility.distance.max}}km. There is a {{= it.weather.probability_of_precipitation.max.v}}% chance of precipitation.

unknown: Sorry, I'm not sure I understand the weather type you're asking about.

response: Go for it. It should be warm and dry {{= it.date.day_string}} in {{= it.location}}.

Hum up to you, it's more likely than not to be dry {{= it.date.day_string}} in {{= it.location}} but it could get wet on you.
Well {{= it.date.day_string}} it's more likely than not to be wet in {{= it.location}}. So bare that in mind.

So {{= it.date.day_string}} it's more likely than not to be dry in {{= it.location}}. So bare that in mind.

name: Really? My favourite cousin is called {{= it.user.name}}... such a small world.
:astonished: I have never met a {{= it.user.name}} before.
{{= it.user.name}}, that's a nice name. My father wanted to call me {{= it.user.name}} but my mother preferred {{= it.user.bot_name}}.
I once met someone called {{= it.user.name}} at an ABBA tribute concert. Those were the days! :dancer:
I once got stuck in a lift with someone called {{= it.user.name}}.

location: Where are you planing on doing that?

I get asked that a lot! Where do you want to know that for?
I can help, but first you'll need to tell me for where?
